response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9‑inch round cake pans, then line the bottoms with parchment paper. Gather all ingredients: flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, salt, eggs, milk, oil, vanilla, and boiling water. Measure each ingredient precisely to ensure consistent texture and flavor throughout.",
  "step2": "In a large mixing bowl, sift together 2 cups all‑purpose flour, 2 cups granulated sugar, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1½ teaspoons baking powder, 1½ teaspoons baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Whisk thoroughly to eliminate lumps and evenly distribute leavening agents. It ensures even flavor and proper rise throughout.",
  "step3": "In a separate bowl, whisk 2 large eggs until light, then add 1 cup whole milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract. Beat until the mixture becomes smooth and slightly frothy, indicating proper emulsification for a tender crumb. This wet blend later combines with dry components.",
  "step4": "Gradually pour the wet mixture into the dry bowl, stirring gently with a spatula. Once combined, slowly whisk in 1 cup boiling water, creating a thin batter. The batter will appear liquid, which is essential for a moist, airy crumb. Avoid overmixing to prevent gluten development. Mix just until smooth.",
  "step5": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Place in the preheated oven and bake for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center emerges with a few moist crumbs. Rotate pans halfway for even browning. Avoid opening the door early to keep heat.",
  "step6": "Allow cakes to cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Frost with a rich chocolate buttercream: beat ½ cup softened butter, 2 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa, 2 tbsp milk, and a pinch of salt until fluffy. Slice and serve immediately."
}
